intro: Drosanthemum curtophyllum, commonly known as the short-leaf gloxinia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically features broad, velvety leaves and produces vibrant, trumpet-shaped blooms in shades of red, orange, and yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant. Due to its ornamental value, it is popular among gardeners who appreciate its unique appearance and ease of care.
